persona.name: Marcus Grant

persona.name: Dr. Elena Torres
persona.description: Dr. Elena Torres is a 45-year-old intellectual property lawyer based in Barcelona, Spain. She holds a PhD in Intellectual Property Law from the University of Barcelona and has over 20 years of experience specializing in copyrights related to literary works, including fiction books. Elena has worked extensively with publishing houses, authors, and legal institutions, providing expertise on international copyright treaties and licensing agreements. Her technological proficiency includes familiarity with digital rights management (DRM) systems and copyright enforcement technologies. Passionate about literature and legal protection, she brings a nuanced understanding of how legal frameworks impact content usage and distribution within the fiction domain. Elena’s unique perspective lies in balancing author rights with public access, making her an invaluable contributor to an ontology that captures legal constraints and rights management for fiction books.
